FDG.function_description: Piano app main menu with feature selection

The current page (Perfect Piano's hamburger menu) provides options for user login, accessing features like Sound Plugin, MIDI Keyboard, song exploration, ad removal, app settings, app information, and promoting the Walk Band app, serving as a navigation hub for additional app functionalities and account management.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the main Perfect Piano page (page 0). First, the hamburger menu icon is clicked to open the menu (page 1). Then, the back arrow icon in the menu is clicked to return to the main page (page 0). There are no branches or loops as the actions form a simple round-trip navigation.

steps.summary: Click hamburger menu icon to open the menu page
Click back arrow icon to return to the main page

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to browse and select different skins (themes) categorized under Fantasy, Scenery, and Cartoon for the Perfect Piano app to customize its appearance.
data_out: navigation back to main app page

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main page (page 0) and clicks the clothing icon to navigate to the theme/skin selection page (page 2). From the theme page (page 2), the user can click the back arrow to return to the main page (page 0).

steps.summary: Click clothing icon to open theme selection page
Click back arrow to return to main page

FDG.function_description: The current page (Perfect Piano main menu) provides a dropdown menu (via three - dot icon) with options to rate the app, like the app, share the app, and access the Discord community, along with main feature tiles for learning piano, using the keyboard, multiplayer games, and managing piano - related records.
data_out: menu options (rate us, like us, share, discord)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Perfect Piano main menu page (page 0). The core action is clicking the three - dot menu icon, which leads to a new page (page 3) where options like rating, liking, sharing the app, and accessing the Discord community are likely presented. There are no branches or loops here as only this single click action is provided for this functional point's flow so far.

steps.summary: Click the three - dot menu icon on the Perfect Piano main menu page

FDG.function_description: The current page, "Songs List," functions as a repository for piano songs (with preload, online, and favorite tabs) where users can view song details (title, difficulty, completion), mark songs as favorites, and likely select songs to learn to play within the piano app's "Learn to Play" feature.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the main page (page 0). First, the user clicks the 'Learn to Play' button (action_ref [0,3]) to navigate to the Songs List page (page 4). Then, the user can click the back arrow (action_ref [4,0]) to return to the main page (page 0). There are no branches or loops as the actions form a simple navigation cycle between the main page and the Songs List page.

steps.summary: Click 'Learn to Play' button to go to Songs List page
Click back arrow to return to main page

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a virtual piano keyboard interface, allowing users to play notes (labeled with their musical notation) by interacting with the on - screen keys, and also providing additional controls (like playback, effects, and menu access) for a simulated piano - playing experience.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the Keyboard feature button to enter the virtual piano interface. Once in the interface, users can interact with playback controls: rewind, play/pause, or fast forward. The rewind action can be repeated, and the fast forward action is a terminal step for that control. The play/pause and rewind controls lead to a playback state page, while fast forward stays in the piano interface.

steps.summary: Click Keyboard feature button to enter piano interface
Click rewind playback control
Click play/pause playback control
Click fast forward playback control
Click rewind playback button (repeatable)

FDG.function_description: The page enables users to log into the piano app's multiplayer game feature by entering a username and password, or by using Google or Facebook authentication, with an option to sign up for a new account.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts with clicking the Multiplayer Game button on the main page (page 0) to navigate to the login page (page 6). On the login page, the user first inputs a username into the username field, then inputs a password into the password field. These input steps occur on the same login page (page 6), with no branching or looping in the provided actions yet.

steps.summary: Click Multiplayer Game button to open login page
Input username into username field
Input password into password field

FDG.function_description: This page enables users to log into the piano app's multiplayer game feature by entering a username and password, or by using Google or Facebook authentication, with an option to sign up for a new account.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main menu (page 0) and clicks the 'Multiplayer Connect' button (action S1) to navigate to the login page (page 6). On the login page, the user can choose to log in with username/password, Google, Facebook, or sign up for a new account, though the provided action only captures the initial navigation to the login page.

steps.summary: Click 'Multiplayer Connect' button to navigate to login page

FDG.function_description: The page is in a loading state, likely intended to display content (such as music - related items) categorized under tabs like HOME, NEW, HOT, STREAM, and NEARBY, with a search bar for finding content and a plus button for adding new items, after being accessed via the Piano Circle feature from the piano app's main menu.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the Piano Circle feature button from the main menu (page 0) to navigate to the Piano Circle page (page 7). On the Piano Circle page, a click on the NEW tab button switches the view to display content under the NEW tab, while a click on the back arrow returns to the main menu. The main flow navigates to the Piano Circle page and can branch to either switch tabs or return to the main menu.

steps.summary: Click Piano Circle feature button to navigate to Piano Circle page
Click NEW tab button to view NEW tab content
Click back arrow button to return to main menu

FDG.function_description: The Records Manager page in the piano app provides access to different categories of recordings (LearnMode Recordings, Keyboards Recordings) and MIDI files stored on the device, allowing users to manage or access their piano - related audio and MIDI data.

Then, the user can click the back arrow button (action [8,0]) to return to the previous page (page 13, likely the main page or a prior screen).

Click back arrow to return to previous page

FDG.function_description: The current page is a login interface for the Perfect Piano app, allowing users to log in using a username and password, or sign in with Google or Facebook, and also providing an option to sign up for a new account.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the Login button in the side menu (page 1) to navigate to the login page (page 9). Then, the username is entered into the username input field on the login page. Next, the password is entered into the password input field on the same login page. The flow focuses on filling the credentials for username/password login, with other login options (Google/Facebook) or sign-up available but not part of this core credential-entry flow.

steps.summary: Click 'Login' button in side menu to open login page
Input username into username field on login page
Input password into password field on login page

FDG.function_description: The Sound Plugin page in the Perfect Piano app allows users to browse and select from a variety of musical instrument sound plugins, including different types of pianos, keyboards, percussion, and string/wind instruments, with some options marked as VIP - exclusive.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 (menu) and clicks the 'Sound Plugin' menu option. This action navigates to page 10, the Sound Plugin page, where various instrument sound plugins (including VIP - exclusive ones) are displayed for browsing and selection.

steps.summary: Click 'Sound Plugin' menu option to navigate to Sound Plugin page

FDG.function_description: The MIDI Keyboard page in the Perfect Piano app provides instructions and a visual guide for connecting a MIDI keyboard to a mobile device via USB MIDI, along with access to a user guide for further assistance.

If the user wants to return, they can click the back button (action_ref [11,0]) to go back to page 0 (the previous page).

Click back button to return to previous page

branches.condition: User wants to return to previous page
User stays on MIDI Keyboard page

FDG.function_description: The current page in the Perfect Piano app's "Explore Songs" section displays a list of user - uploaded piano - related songs (under tabs like FEATURED, WEEKLY HOT, etc.). FDG.function_description: The current page in the Perfect Piano app displays a promotional overlay for the Perfect Piano VIP subscription, highlighting benefits like no advertisements, exclusive timbre, exclusive avatar, and multiplayer VIP tag, and offers the option to purchase permanent VIP access for $5.99.

steps.summary: Click 'Remove ADs' menu option to open VIP promotion overlay

FDG.function_description: The current page is the Settings page of the Perfect Piano app, allowing users to configure options like Pre - Count, Metronome, Screen Pressure Detect, and Reverb for the piano application.

FDG.function_description: The "About" page of the Perfect Piano app displays the app developer's (Revontulet Soft Inc) copyright information, links to legal documents (Music Composition License, DMCA, Privacy Policy), contact email, and a Discord server link for user reference and support.

FDG.function_description: The current page on Google Play displays the "Walk Band - Multitracks Music" app's details, including its rating, download count, description, and options to learn more or explore features, allowing users to view and potentially install the app.
